description: Introduction to the history of Eastern Africa from the nineteenth century to the present. Attention to the region's pre-colonial history and institutions is stressed, in order to understand both the transformations brought by European colonialism as well as its limits. The final weeks of the course will examine the differing political, economic, and religious trajectories of the new nation-states since independence in the 1960s.
label: History of Eastern Africa
sectionDegreeAttributes: Hist&Philosoph Perspect, and Non-Western Cultures course.
